description.narrative: The project use film community discussions and grassroots mobilization to deman political and social accountability. InformAction is non-profit organization that use film and community discussions to encourage active and peaceful participation in the democ ratic process. The project use camera and screen to give ordinary citizens the confidence to speack out encouranging them to make demands from a position of understanding and accurate information. The project will achieve this through use of mobile screeni ngs debates and mass visual leafleting of DVDs. As a result of the earlier support by the Embassy a documentation programme is being developed around 'forgotten' victims and survivors of the 2007/2008 election-related violence. The documentation will empow er the victims collates evidence and sustains the demand for justice. The organization carry out conflict mitigation work in areas that have remained divided and vulnerable to political manipulation. The films and community discussions focus on issues of j ustice impunity and reconciliation and encourage people to shun notions of 'community protection'. They are encouraged to make politicians take indvidual responsibility for their actions. This is critical in the run up to ICC cases and anticipated general election in 2013.Empowering citizens to take an active part in seeking justice and establishing a new democratic government means going well beyond the conventional reach of urban based organisations amd mainstream information flow by giving ordinary peopl e a vehicle to express themselves make demands and mobilize for progressive and peaceful purposes. This will be achieved by a program of work that focuses on community empowerment and mobilization along with documentation in the ground from a network of hu man rights activists and videographers who can profile and encourage ordinary people to speak out and demand the rewards of a new constitution including a new political order.
